text: Bottle at Cantillon, split 3 ways with the wife and Mike (bytemesis), cheers! Pours a hazy copper color, small off-white head that leaves a ring of lace. Aroma is full of signature Cantillon funk, oak, hay, horse blanket, light leather notes, light citrus rind and an underlying floral note. Taste is a balance of cognac, Cantillon funk, light citrus, light floral, light hay....mild acidic, mild bitter. Great balance. Finishes medium dry with a sweet bread note, bitter brett/hops, deep funk, horse blanket and oak. Outstanding!

Cotteridge tasting #3 on 20th May 2017. Cheers Dave (WingmanWillis) for this offering. Hazy golden pour, thin head, wispy. Best Gueuze Ive had so far, not too sharp or sour, the Gognac barrels calming down the Lambic nicely for me and my palate. Still tart and leaning towards citrusy in nature, but mellow compared to most in this style.
Bottle shared @CWC III, thanks to Wingmanwillis, cheers Dave. Hazy golden amber beer with small head. Aroma is cheese, funky and lemon. Taste is lemon, citrus, barnyard, cheese and sour. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 2015. Pite w browarze w maju 2017. Gładziutki, czysty, zbalansowany, grzeczny/nieprzegięty lambik. Kwaśność przeciętna ku niskiej. Pełny. Beczka zaznaczona. Perfekcyjne, średnie wysycenie. Delikatne (biało)winno-dębowa cierpkość. Dosłownie akcencik octu. Finisz wytrawny, nieco goryczkowy. Totalnie w moim stylu, genialne gueuze.
Bottle at CWC III; hazy yellow pour, aroma has straw, horse blanket, citrus, some apple, quite a lot going on in the aroma, taste has tart citrus, some hint of vanilla, apple brandy.

Tried at the cotteridge beer share 2017. And my pen ran out when i started rating this so my notes were a touch thin. Hazy golden colour with white head. Citrus emon in the aroma and taste. medium body and very drinkable.
Batch 3 bottle. Pours hazy orange with no head. Horse blanket, leather, Chardonnay grapes. Light body. Low carbonation. Medium sweetness. Great funk.

Bottle at Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. Hazy golden with white head. Fruity aroma with notes of acetone, cider, lemon and some minerals. Very sour flavor with noted of cider, lemon, wood, acetone, wild yeasts and white grapes. Flat, medium-bodied. Excellent.
Niesamowite piwo. Potężny aromat, mega wyraźny koniak, Bretty, beczka. Wytrawne, dużo stajni, brettów, beczki. Cudownie bogate, wybitne.
Bottle at the brewery. Slightly hazy orange color. Aroma is very funky with notes oak and barnyard. Very sour, lemon, orange peel, oak, vinegar flavors. Light-bodied, dry finish. Very good.

Bottle shared at KyotoLeftys 10,000th rating celebration. 2012 vintage (brewed in 2010). Complex nose of ripe fruit, plenty of cognac, light funk, mild oxidation, and some fumes. Lightly hazy amber color. Thin stone fruit, mild funkiness,honey. Stretches into light bitterness in final. Thin-medium body. Milder than many from this brewery. Very pleasnant.
Bottle - Barrel and apple notes, soft cognac. Clear gold with a small white head. Woody, cooked apple earthiness and light acidity. Nice and a dry finish.

Bottle from the brewery, 2013. My 10,000th rate.
Funky nose, grapefruit and cognac, horse blanket, leather. Lovely clear golden color. Lace. Citrus, grapes, honey, nice sweet edge. Perfect body, lightly sour. Great. As it warmed, some peaches and apricot also came through. A superbly balanced beer.
Apple and almond aromas, slight phenolic character. Long and sweet cognac and raisins finish.

Bottle, thanks to some random Americans! Pours clear orange. Nose is apple, Peach, white grapes, some wood .palate is dry wood, grapes, just a touch phenolic and sour. Fruity and woody finish. Good but too,woody

Botella de @Brasserie Cantillon. 21/02/17 
Color amarillo, sabor agrio ligero, fruta, madera expectacular.
Pris à Cantillon, une de mes favorites! Goût très complexe. On sens bien le cognac en fin de gorgé.

Dégustée à loccasion de lanniversaire du Vices et Versa en compagnie de Marc-André. Un grand merci à létablissement pour nous offrir un tel évènement annuel! Une robe ambrée, des bulles qui ne séteignent jamais. Une gueuze unique en son genre. Je dirais que de lensemble des produits de Cantillon qui mont été donnés de déguster, ce produit est de loin le plus original. Le côté lambic est modéré ici. Peu ou pas sèche ni poussiéreuse, un liquide au corps bien ample et peu funky. Une douce chaleur de cognac, du cuir, de lorange et du tabac. Très différent dun assemblage ou même dun lambic, mes 2 verres de 7 onces mont accompagnés plusieurs heures pendant lesquelles ils nont rien perdu de leur complexité. À reboire certainement!

Bottle all to myself at the brewery. Pours clear orange with a thin white head. Aroma is apple, tart fruits, a little booze and funk. Taste is a mellow sour, apple plenty of funk and a little boozy aftertaste. Good carbonation. 
Had this beer a whole ago before rating and was one of my favourites. Happy to report it is still fantastic.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Bottle shared at Cantillon - batch 3, bottled Dec 2015. Semi-hazy orange pour with a thin white head. Notes of macerated apples, pears, cognac, lambic funk, dank cellar, unripe pears. Quite dry, with a very complex bouquet of aroma - curious to try this one with a bit of age on it.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Bon, celle-ci était la meilleure de la dégustation à la brasserie. Malgré tout, les gueuzes ne sont pas mon style de bières et Cantillon est particulièrement marqué dans ce domaine. Alors voilà.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a thin bubbly to lacy off white head. Aroma is of butterscotch, citrus, white grapes, apple. Taste is of grapes, citrus, apple, lime, acidic, hint of pear, melon, butterscotch, sweet finish. Oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

750ml bottle 2012 vintage batch 2, was a pleasant surprise when this was pulled out of someones bag at our New Years gathering! Pours clear golden yellow with minimal bubbles but a touch of carbonation. Nose is old and wise, complex white grape, wine, attic, wood, lemony citrus. Taste is similar to the nose with nice layers of old lambic funk and musty citrus. Cognac is present but not dominant throughout. Moderate acidity. A beer to sip and ponder!

From notes. Enjoyed at Cantillon on November 10. 750 mL bottle. The pour is a nice darker golden orange, relatively clear, with a thin white head. The aroma is lovely. There is a great citrusy acidity to it and the signature Cantillon funk. I like the sweetness of the cognac barrel throughout. The light grape must is nice as well. The flavor is nice and acidic. There is a great sourness and a light funk. The cognac and grape just go so well together. Its balanced, tart, crisp, and fantastic. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a lightly soft carbonation and a lingeringly funky and acidic sweetness of the cognac with a tart grape skin. This is awesome. Such a great start to the trip!

Bue en bouteille de 75cl chez Cantillon
Couleur ambrée, grosse effervescence peu de mousse
Nez sur la gueuze et avec une toute petite pointe de cognac
Attaque en bouche caractéristique de la gueuze cantillon avec juste un arrière goût vineux du cognac et de lalcool. Pas si complexe...

750ml bottle. Pale amber colour. Modest white head which disappears quite quickly. Acidity, vanilla, almondy notes or notes of marzipan, creamy citrusses (sic!) in the aroma. Woody notes, citrussy notes at first. Slight acidity. Oakiness. Oak, woody, spicy finish. Slightly acidic, spicy, citrussy, bit sweet aftertaste. Maybe even hints of peat. Balance is amazing. Fruity notes as well. It has nice, smooth, silky body. Definitely more body than usual gueuze. Rather low carbonated beer. A masterpiece. Will miss this one.

Flavor that changes while airing, great lambic in my eyes.

After a some resting he will taste even more subtile and full.
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours golden color, small white head. Aroma of oak, quite sweet. Taste is sour, wood, mainly oak, bit fruity.

Bottle @ the source. A very very long time want! Pours clear amber with a white head. Aroma has some smooth basement funk, green apples, stable, vinegar, wood and slight sweet cognac kinda notes. The taste has notes of tart green apples, vinegar, smooth funk, green grape skin and some sweet cognac which also provides this a pretty smooth and oily body. Extremely interesting and deep gueuze, though much more "straight forward" than I would have guessed. This one was pretty fresh though and I would love to see hot this turns out with some aging as for every rare cantillon beers haha. Awesome!
Bottle @ Cantillon. Light hazy dark golden pour with a off white head. Notes of funk, apples, lemon peel, some musty oak, wood, light barrel character and some floral notes.

Fľaa v pivovare priamo od majiteľa. Zlatá farba, biela pena. Vôňa sladová, kyselkavá, vínová, jemne sladká. Chuť osvieujúca, kyselkavá, koňak, červené jablká, vine. Veľmi dlhá dochuť, uasne piteľné, osvieujúce.

Bottle at brewery. Golden color small white head. Aroma of malt, light sourness, bayrnard, vinous notes. Taste, distinct sourness with vinous notes, apples, cognac, light cheesy notes. Long refreshing sour finish. Very tasty,

Bottle @ Cantillon. Pours clear orange with a small offwhite head. Aromas of gooseberries, deep funk, sweet grapes, apple juice, tannins, citrus. Taste has sweet apples, grapes, cognac, tannic, cheese, stable, citrus, vinegar, orange.

Slightly hazy golden color, a bit of off-white foam. Aroma is sweet with some rum and cognac notes, some vinegar acidity, quite complex. Taste starts with dark fruits, sweet spirits, slight burnt sugar, dusty cellar, slight bitterness on the finish. Medium to light bodied with light carbonation. Really complex lambic, one of the most interesting I ever had.
UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Tasted at Zwanze day 2016. Cloudy yellow pour. Aroma is kind of boozy but taste is smooth, really amazing gueze. Really happy to try this one!

750 mL bottle. Batch 2. Originally reviewed 9/15/2013.
Slightly hazy yellow. No head. Not completely lifeless, but not a lot going on.

Fruity sweet aroma. Some oak and lactic lemony acids. Wheat and some grassiness.

Taste is sour, but the oaky vanilla flavor moderates it. Very oaky, really. Some fruitiness I cant put my finger on. I guess thats the cognac barrel, but Im no expert on cognac. Grainy in the finish.

Good sourness and well balanced by the liquor, oak, and vanilla.

The barrel adds complexity, even if I cant really distinguish it.

05-05-16 // sample at Cantillon Quintessence 2015. Paired with comté cheese. Alcoholic notes from the cognac barrels. Low carbonation. Dry sour. 2015 vintage, needs some years to rest to develop complexity.

Grass, herbal, light butterscotch, vanilla, barnyard, leather, earthy and floral. Very nice, soft and subtle lambic with soft carbonation. Taste of barnyard, quenching dry, grape, apple cider, with a leathery sock finish.

750 ml bottle at Keirs 50th tasting - thanks again, everybody! Pours a clear gold with a thin white ring for a head. Notes of oak, cognac, vanilla, grapes, lemon zest, saltines, nuts, and faint minerals. Medium-bodied, with low carbonation and a sweet, sour, coating, tannic, smooth mouthfeel. Unusual for Cantillon. Certainly not one of my favorites of theirs, but very interesting to try.

@Akkurat x2. First time I had this along with Arman4 series, the second time with Zenne. Unfortunately Zenne made the experience less amazing :p

Incredibly refined balance and great complex taste with some vineous notes and lots of character from the barrels. Yes, the cognac really comes through and I love it!

75cl 2012 Vintage kindly shared by oldmanriver, thanks Walt Disney for the entry ticket to drown my Red Devils tears. - Bref: cognac barrel, age and the uncut oily lambiek base help to cushion the trademark bonedry Cantillon lemon funk in suave silky textures of white wine, cheese and grapes. Reminds me of the best jonge lambiek by Cantillon and Girardin. Very smooth and sessionable, like the whey milk lapped up by a De Bruynes suckling pig.

Style et résumé: Lambic vieillie en fût de cognac. 
Comment:  Dégustation Manseau 2016. 02/2012.
Portrait: Une robe jaune sans mousse. Un nez classique de lambic et de gueuze, de bois, un peu simple. Une bouche acide de lambic, ni plus ni moins. Je ne lai pas trouvé renversante. 
Note:  7+/10
Sample @ Cantillon Quintessence 2016. Copper body with a tiny head. Cognac, wood, grape, sweet sherry like notes, vinous, funky, tart, cellar. Excellent.

Sampled at Quintessence 2016. Pours copper with no head at all. Aroma is huge wood, grape, cognac, sherry, vinous, funky and acidic. Pretty sour, but also moderately sweet. Medium bodied. Long funky vinous finish. Excellent.

Light copper in appearance with a small head that dissipates fairly quickly. The cognac is prevalent both on the nose and in the taste. This is quite a fantastic beer and Im glad they have remade this one!

Quintessence 2016. Light hazy full golden with thin white head. Light sour grapes on sweet grape base, tortilla chips, grassy white wine, chalkiness, cognac notes, light nutty, cashew. Medium sour, medium mineral/saltiness. Smooth body, crisp feel, soft carbonation.
Pairing with comté is great.

Bottle sampled at Quintessence. Slight hazy dark golden with bubbly white head. Roasted nuts, caramel, cognac, sherry, sour and sweet grapes, wood, hay and funk. Under medium sour and light sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with a bit sparkly carbonation. Very good, especially the nose.

Bouteille 750ml, bottle share. Couleur dorée voilée, fine mousse blanche laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre. Arôme de cognac, levures sauvages, boisé. Goût de levures sauvages, boisé, alcool, acidité moyenne-faible. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen.

Chêne, fruits acides, citron, fruits à noyau, vin blanc et cuir sont les choses qui me sautent au nez. En bouche, lacidité du bois dirige mes papilles. La bouche est belle comme une Cantillon. La finale est aiguisée, très parfumée, élégante, unique. Merci à Tommy pour cette belle dégustation!
Bottle @ Cantillon 15/5-15. Fruity with oak/wood, cognac, also bretty and light acidic notes. Dry finish with grapefruit/peel.

Have had this a couple times. The most memorable was in Brussels as part of a epic 5 course dinner paring. 750ml bottle pours out a light golden apple color. Nose is cognac funk barrel leather barnyard. Taste is more of the cognac funky barnyard some grape notes and plenty of the wood.

Poured copper and small white head that quickly dissipated. Very sweet oak aroma. Floral and barnyard in nose. Flavor is lemon and grapefruit zest. The sourness is well balanced by the oak and funk. Very rich mouthfeel for this brewery. Very nice.

75cl bottle via trade. It pours a hazy rich golden color with a minimal amount of large white bubbles. Aroma is rich dusty musty funky white grapes, lemon juice, horse blanket, basement. Taste is funky and lemony, with a mellow sweetness with notes of white wine and cognac, Plenty of stone fruit, basementm horse blanket and funk. Loads of lemon character, but not tart and puckering as normal Cantillon gueuze. This is incredibly mellow and soft, super juicy and easy to drink. Definitely less extreme than regular gueuze. Body is medium with fine sparkling carbonation. Overall, an interesting experiment and an excellent beer for sure.
Bottle at WTWBA 2015 in Minneapolis. Highlight of the event for me. Slight hazy gold pour. Aroma and taste of oak, cognac, funk, and some cheese. Delicious!

How: Bottle.
Where: From the brewery.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, tart, cognac, acidic, sour.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, fruit, acidic, cognac.
Bottle at Zwanze Day Zurich. My last one for today. Quite crisp and refreshing, inviting nose.

Bottle thanks to Kurt. Decanted, pours a hazy gold with medium frothy white head. The aroma is strong funk, cognac, barnyard. Medium mouth, nice funk, cognac is very subtle, leather, grape, light tartness, very impressive.
Bottle at Akkurat. Aroma is cognac, slight citric, slight hay, slight booze. Taste is slight sweet, a hint of citrus, slight hay, a hint of grape.

Drank at the Cantillon brewery. This one is aged in oak barrels that had previously housed cognac. You can definitely taste and smell the cognac and the oak. I think this might be my favourite. Very rich oak. Very balanced.

Bottle at cantillon . Light yellow body looks like white wine. Faint bourbon aroma , sour vin, oak, smooth palate , some balance to he dryness from the bourbon I believe . Dry but not as puckering as the lsdt one. Awesome beer
Enjoyed at Cantillon. Pours an Apple juice colour. Aromas are some mild funk and sour. I get some boozy cognac too. Flavours are funk, cheese, citrus rind, and some oaky cognac barrel. Excellent.

Bottle at Cantillon. Last one before we went. Incredibly enjoyable morning but you have to eat at some point and sadly, Cantillon dont serve food. The staff were breaking in to their lunch on the table next to us whilst drinking an unlabelled mystery lambic which they would only refer to as the beer that doesnt exist yet. My understanding is that it will exist for us mere mortals in the coming weeks. Anyway, the 50°N-4°E was first poured into an ostentatious glass decanter then in to my glass. Golden with a White head. Lemony citrus on the nose. Plenty of funk and acidity. Woody, tart and well balanced. The cognac is there but not in a massive way. It balances things surprisingly well lending a richness. Lots going on.

Bottle shared by jackl, 5/15/15. Thanks! Slightly hazy golden, thin fizzy head, decent retention. Aroma of pepper, citrus, funk, leather, wood, tannic grape. The taste is pale malt, tannic wine, funk, horseblanket, leather, wood. Medium bodied, low carbonation, lingering tartness.

2012 bottle thanks to angst! And thanks to Tony for helping with the trade. Aroma is ultra funky. Big moldy cheese and barnyard, moderate sour lemon, oak, and white wine. Tastes the same. More oak and white wine though. Incredibly smooth.

Bottle shared by Kevin at SLO Beer Bro night in June. Pours a very light orange to yellow with no carb. Other glasses were poured a little harder and got a slight bit of bubble but nothing to speak of in my taster. Aroma is white wine, funk and some shoe leather. Taste is very thin and again white wine forward. Slight alcohol booze but more in that "this is likely going to give me a hangover" kind of way. Hands down my least favorite Cantillon to date.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottle (750 ml) @ Cantillon 150515. Fruity and bretty with cognac notes, wood/oak, light acidic, light to medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry and acidic with dried fruits and woody notes.

Bottle shared at Cantillon, 12 May 15. Pours a rich straw yellow. Aroma is barrel, slight cognac, taste is complex sour, but tempered by the cognac barrel, some spice even. Palate is round and soft, very interesting
Bottle at Cantillon - pours golden yellow. Mild funk, lemons, tart and cognac in the nose. Taste is earthy, lemons, slight cognac.

Bottle to glass at Cantillon. Pours a pale golden color with a nice white head. Aroma is mildly tart, nice fruit character, big cognac presence. Flavor is mildly sweet, tart, and very smooth. Excellent lingering tartness and cognac in the finish. Very nice.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Nice big funky aroma, oak, fruity, musty. Taste is a little thin, oak, funk, vinegar. Thin, dry and tart. Solid

Clear Golden pour with a rather dense head. Head is lasting. Nose has whitewine, lemon, candy barley. Taste: The barrels has big influense on the taste and the abv is more present in the beer than usual for cantillon. Mix between riesling and gueuze. Very complex with a nice aftertaste.
032815:old barnyard aroma,yellow,hazy, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, light sour barnyard finish.

750ml corked and tapped bottle served in a tulip glass.
Review #1000! Special occasion -> Special Beer! Bottled in 2012.
A: Pours a clear golden yellow color in the beginning (end is very cloudy) forming a small thin bubbled white head that dissipates quickly leaving only very few lacings in the glass. 
S: Delicious Lambic nose. Strong notes of sweet pale malts, vinegar, fruits, wood and light flowery hops. Notes of leather. Some metallic notes too. White grapes, apples and apricot... Cognac... 
T: Slightly sweet upfront: Notes of sweet pale malts and acid fruits. Strong notes of white grapes, apricot and wood. Apple vinegar. Quite smooth and light sour for a Cantillon Gueuze. Light hops bitterness. Notes of leather with same metallic notes in the very end. The only negative point is that the taste is not very persistent. 
M: Medium body. Low carbonation. Fruity, sour and woody aftertaste. 
O: Absolutely drinkable. Just another Cantillon masterpiece.
Golden coloured and hazy. Has a white head, diminishing. Aroma of mold, earth, white-wine, old cellar. Flavor starts sweet, then acid, bitter finish. Dry, dry texture.

Aroma: sour fruits and hints of apple. 
Flavour: sour berries and sweetness. Yeasty aftertaste. 
Colour: cloudy pale amber with a fading white head. 
From: rasmus40

Bottle. Slightly hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, tart, lemon, fruit, barnyard, little leather and notes of cognac. Flavour is malt, lemon, barnyard, grapefruit, citric, sour, acid, leather, brett, notes of cognac, dry and a little bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Hazy golden with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, lots of lemon, wood and heavy barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 270315

Bottle @ Johns. Pours yellow with a very small white head. Aroma is sourness, dusty, wood, barnyard, grapes, light moldy, citrus. Flavor is sour, grapes, wood, dusty, leather, light mold, barnyard, citrus, lemon. Medium body, soft carbonation, light acidic finish. 270315
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, wood, leather, white wine, malt and hops. Nice
Yellowish color. The smell is old and cheesy. The taste is strongly sour with a less sour aftertaste and some fruity aromas. Its also a bit more subtile in the aftertaste as well.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 At the brewery. Hazy orange color with hardly any head. Funk, but very different from your usual Gueuze: Some freshness, more cheese, wood, even a bit caramel. Pineapples, damn! Max says it?s moee like Fisalis. Taste is lemony and pineapples, and surprisingly, there?s a bit of caramel in there. Finish is dry and even a bit taninic. Even a bit of tobacco lingering on the palate. Low carbonation. Great, as usual from Cantillon! 
EDIT: after having had this another time at Zwanze 15 and comparing it with my other Cantillon ratings, it cannot be that this one is so low in there. Rearranged the ratings a bit. 9-3-9-4-18

Bottle shared at Zwanze 16. Lots of barrel, a bit dusty, pineapples, starfruit. Taste is pineapples, starfruit, barrel. An amazing beer, probably the best bottle of this Ive had. 9-4-9-4-18

Pours a slightly cloudy, almost murky rich yellow color, with no head at all.

The aromas reveal lots of warm oak, accompanied by leather, a decent tartness and white lemon zest. 

Tastes of tart funk, matured white grape skin, musty, old lime and a dry touch of oaken Cognac. While the beer has a distinct, slightly fruity wooden character, its typical sourness is a bit subdued. The wooden aspect contains a slight sweetness of fermented apples, leading to a medium body with low carbonation.
Bottle at the brewery: Golden, slightly hazy. Rich geuziness (made that word up) with just a hint of cognac. Very vinous (white) and fruity (grapes, pears). Insanely pleasant amount of sourness.
Golden hazy with small white head. Sweet and sour fruity aroma. Rich excellent fruity taste, carbonated, refreshing. Blend of lambics 2010...2012, bottle #0472.

Bottle at Cantillon, 2012 bottling. Very pale yellow, small white head. Crisp and funky lemon rind aroma mixed with faint sweet cognac. Medium carbonation. Medium to high sourness. Caramelised citrus rind, like a lemon marmalade but with the sourness ramped up. Cognac most manifests as sweet counterpoint to the sourness and then a booze kicker in the finish.

Amber-ish, just a little light. Big white head that fades quickly and leaves some lacing behind. Big nose of funk and a slight bit of sweet cognac. Not overpowering though, or I would pass on it. Taste is a typical fruity Cantillon with funk and bright citrus. Finish tart and refreshing.

Dark amber in appearance. The cognac influence is very apparent amongst the brett funk - a slight sweet caramel tone develops in the beer. Tart but very fine caramel/cognac tones on the palate. Slight sweetness appears upon warming up.

Couleur jaune dapparence moine pétillante quune gueuze Cantilon. Moins dacidité et une touche légère de coganc, de vieillissement en fût. Surtout présent en rétro olfaction mais qui reste bien présent et remplis bien la bouche. Plus elle se réchauffe plus le côté cognac se révèle et simpose. Très équilibrée.

Bottle via and shared with oakbluff. Pale copper in appearance with a moderate amount of carbonation. Aromas are of a deep earthy funk, white grape skins, rose jelly, and wet wood. More wet old wood in the mouth, along with oiled rope, lemon and funky/salty brine soaked cheese. A bit of an acidic burn going down, but in a good way. Off the carts complexity. A rare treat more to mark my 2k rating.

Pour clear bright yellow, with a small fluffy white head. 
Aroma is obviously a lot like the regular Cantillon gueuze, but has a lot more sweetness to it, some booze, green grapes, grape skin, barrel, slight cognac. 
Taste is surprisingly sweet, but still has some classic sourness to it. 
Watery - semi media, body, with a somewhat flat carbonation. I really enjoyed this, but is something else.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 Bottle 2012 at Cantillon. Pours orange with no head. Nose is quite boozy, acid, vinegar. This js something special. Starts off like a sweet geuze, but goes into a wonderfully complex taste where the normal lambic taste blends in with the obvious cognac taste. A little bitterness to finish it off. Absolutely in love with this beer.

Sample from 2012 bottle at (Hopp)Kurtkeller 016: Cantillon-tastic 01 on 10/11/2014. Pours a hazy yellow-gold color with a thin white head that recedes steadily to a wispy film. Spotty lacing on the glass. The aroma is citrusy and woody with a bit of herbal wheat in the background. Medium-bodied with a vinous character and notes of green apples, oak and funky yeast. The finish is tart with the cognac coming through subtly behind the funky tart fruits. Very good brew all around.

Bottle consumed at the brewery. Clear pale golden pour with a white head. Slightly malty and sour nose - just a hint of booze. Soft, slightly sour, mellow. Wonderfully complex without being overwhelming. Some cognac in the finish with some lingering bitterness.

750 ml bottle

Lucky enough to score a bottle of this last year on a trip to Brussels, I have been eagerly waiting for a chance to open it ever since. Rating number 3,000 seemed as good a reason as any so while the palates were still fresh I shared one at a recent tasting. In hindsight I do wish that I could have split it with more folks who helped me reach the milestone because this world class release sets the bar high even for Cantillon. Hopefully folks like b3shine, ContemplateBeer, tastybeer, hezron, malachi, 1FastSti, Ughsmash, miketd, leaparsons, chriso, Travlr, and all those other people I have shared beers with over the years get a shot at this if theyve not already stored a case in the cellar.

Aroma / Appearance - A golden flat base lacks much, if any, carbonation. Typical of an old lambic it pours with no head. Cognac and lemons grace the air with a smooth vinegary finish that is not nearly as intense as originally expected.

Flavor / Palate - Cognac and lemons provide all the depth this gem requires. The light smooth mouthfeel finishes with a tart kick. A long lasting finish reminds one of a great bottle of vintage cognac pulled from a dusty cellar. I wish I had another bottle to share with people down the road because this is an experience that everyone should get at least once during their rating careers.

Bottle 0647 at Moeder Lambic, decanted into a flask and let sit for 5 minutes before serving. Clear Holden with a small pale head. Aroma is the best funk aroma ever, barnyard, mild cheese, horse blanket, with hints of white wine, olives, honey, white truffle, apricot. Light bodied, almost ethereal, but with a lingering funky character that makes me beg for more. Taste is almost indescribable, funky and lightly tart mild stone fruits, olives, dry white wine, sharp cheese. Best. Gueuze. Ever.

140801. Bottle, thanks tderoeck for sharing.
Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is fruity with citrus, apricots, brett, funky, hay, barnyard, oak, cognac. Taste is light sweet fruity with a light/medium tart woody note, finish is light/medium bitter with some pear, citrus and cognac coming through. Texture very smooth and oily, medium bodied, soft carbonation.

1/VIII/14 - 75cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ Belgo-Swedish Crazy Summer Trade Tasting - BB: n/a, 2014 vintage (2014-865) Big thanks to 77ships for picking this one up for me!
Clear light orange beer, creamy irregular white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: brett of course, sour apples, pretty fruity, peaches, bit lemony. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: soft sourness, woody notes, walnuts, bit lemony, soft bitterness, fruity, apricots. Aftertaste: bitter touch, sourness burns a bit, lemon peel and orange peel, peaches. Surprised that someone below me mentions metallic, since Im usually pretty sensitive for that, but now I dont taste it.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with decent white head. Aroma is very expressive and perfumed: cognac, white fruits (pears), flowers and oak. Taste has also an intense cognac presence along with sweet fruits and a very light lactic tartness per Cantillon standards. Palate is very mellow and suits this one nicely. I prefer regular gueuze but this is very interesting take on the style.

For my good friend mattyb83 on the night before his wedding, congrats!! Bottled 23 Feb 2010 pours a slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet with a mild funk, smooth. Starts with dry horse blanket, big tart sour in the middle, with a cognac and barrel presence on the finish. Well balanced and tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2014 One of the uncompromising and creative Cantillon lambics, matured on cognac barrels for 2 years and named after the brewerys geographic coordinates. Yellow-white, creamy, thinnish but very stable head, like the classic Cantillon Gueuze, colour also identical to the Gueuze (old gold with the typical champenoise sparkling); aroma breathes Cantillon in all respects, with its characteristic impressions of wet hay, lemon juice, rancid butter, dry sherry and sour, unripe berries, but in comparison with the standard Gueuze less citric acid and more woody, more mature as it were, with a very subtle, but still recognisable cognac flavour; this is reflected in the taste, which attacks less agressively than the Gueuze (as in: less citric acid), softer, more rounded maltiness, green apple and grapefruit, sharply tingling carbonasition as in any good geuze, aftertaste woody and dry, although seemingly less bitter than the Gueuze, with again that subtle, almost vague hint of cognac. An interesting experiment and a subtle variation on the geuze theme - and considering the limitations of the genre in terms of production, any authentic and uncompromised variation in geuze is welcome to me.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2016 New Rating. Bottle shared by me at Astoria share. 1st vintage. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of faint cognac, funk, oak, earthy acid and touch of sweet orange peel. Medium body. 

Old Rating: Pours golden. White head. Nose/taste of funk, oak, light cognac, earthy funky peach and lemon. Medium body. 3.9

ivorywhite head disappears immediately with big CO2 bubbles. golden colour. aroma is very fruity and reminds a lot of foufoune, hay, horse. taste like aroma with a bitter and slight wry finish. medium body and carbonation. nice, but couldnt detect the cognac though.  bottle 75cl

Bouteille de 750 ml, à la brasserie. Arômes sauvages présentant un intriguant côté vineux et boisé. Robe dorée, effervescence moyenne et légère mousse. En bouche, cette gueuze se montre un peu moins rustique que la gueuze Cantillon classique (bue en parallèle), même si le caractère de la maison est évident. Elle se distingue par une belle présence vineuse et boisée. Finale bien sèche présentant une acidité dintensité moyenne. Très intéressant, mais je crois quau final, je préfère la gueuze régulière.

Bottle at the brewery

A- golden yellow, 2 finger head that fades extremely quickly with little remnants left on the glass

S- lemon rind, indistinct sweetness, citrus notes

T- lemon, slight wheat, light apricot, sour back end, metallic tinge

M- medium/light with low carbonation

D- this was definitely not my favorite beer at cantillon. The metallic aftertaste really ruined it for me.
Eccezzionale sposalizio tra lambic e cognac, con un equilibrio incredibile. Una birra che entusiasma lanima già dal primo sorso !! Indimenticaile....

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2014 Bottle @ Cantillon. Creamy body with apple juice like feeling where the barrel has given flavors of apples, fruit and wood. Compared to the Cognac Lambic tried at Akkurat this was smoother and a little boozier. Not too sour yet the usual Cantillon touch to it which balance the flavors, way too sessionable.

Hazy yellow body with low head. Aroma has fruity sourness, oak character with very light cognac notes, peach, apritcot. Taste has light sourness with woody after taste. Balanced after taste. Body is full, light carbonation.

Pours yellow gold with a small white head, quite hazy. Wonderful aroma, delicate, complex funk, farmhouse, light cheese which is great, oak, sweet grapes from the cognac, just crazy complexity, mushroom, earth. Not as dry as most cantillon beers, light sweetness with tons of earthy flavor, delicate sourness gets a bit firmer in the finish. Lovely light feel.

finally! shared a bottle at the cantillon brewery. poured a murky yellow colour with a white head. funky lemons, grapes, oak, with the cognac in the background, apricots, taste starts with lemons, tart, funky sourness, cognac realy shines true in the aftertaste. wood, dry finish, smooth mouthfeel, the vinous lambic taste is so complex in this beer. and i would love to try this one after some years. think it gets perfectly balanced when the cognac had some more time. overall... its worth every penny to try it for 18 euros in the brewery. (if you cant trade it) had a great time and this beer was just the cherry on the pie

Bottle 0.75l at HBF 2014, Helsinki. Bottled 2012. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits and sourness. Quite pure and fresh.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2014 
75 cl bottle @ HBF14. Bottled 27.02.2012, BBE 27.02.2032
Based on lambic brewed 23.02.2010
Aroma has earthy notes, farmyard notes, grapefruit and Cantillon house aroma. Flavour is tart and somewhat sour with cognac tones, grapefruit, some earthy tones and distant lactic tones. The cognac was present only on the first sip  after that the grapefruit notes took over. Not the most aggressive on sourness, but smooth and balanced. Very nice stuff.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with a Light tan head. The smell is oak, sour and funk with a hint of booze. The taste is wood, acidic, citric, ending tart and dry. Light with wonderful carbonation....perfect. I think with a bit of time the taste will match the palate
Vollmundiger Antrunk mit heller Bitterkeit, leichte Malzigkeit. Säuerlich bleibend, Zitrusnoten. Ausgewogen, gut. 11/12/12/10/11/11

Generously shared by t0rinbro. Thanks Bobby. It pours a pale gold color with a white head. The aroma is funky sour citrus fruit with some light barrel funk and darker fruit. The flavor has some cognac heat and nice complementary sour funk with orange and grapefruit. Good stuff.

Bottle shared with a friend. Pours clear golden orange with a small off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly and leaves decent lacing. Initial aroma is quite strong, room filling with funky brett barnyard notes, woody tannins, brandy. Initial aroma is so strong there is almost a turpentine feel to it, but that fades as the beer breathes. Flavor is quite dry, lightly funky with some basement and horse blanket notes, but not overly so. Fruity, lots of barrel feel, with some cognac essence present as well. A lot of complexity in this beer.... Light body, fairly light carbonation, particularly for Cantillon.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 2007 bottle, big thanks to Bill for hosting. Hazy yellow pour with no head, aroma brought notes of slight cognac, white grape, nice vanilla, earth, slight horseblanket, earth, nice. Taste is a mix of cognac, earth, grass, cognac, into some lemon, nice grass, lemony notes, slight grain, finishing fairly tart, slightly dry. Wow this is complex and tasty.
Bottle @ Cantillon  It pours hazy golden with a small head sour, fruity, lemon, vinegar, citrus, tart. glad to have tried this! :)

Shared a bomber with Sherm1016 on Christmas Eve....Thanks!! Pours a hazy golden color with thin, quickly dissipating head. Nose is a hint of wet hay; hint of hops. Taste is a funky sour...just a bare hint of booze...maybe thats the cognac...the cognac wasnt otherwise evident. This was an excellent beer to enjoy...tasty.

750ml bottle, purchased at West Lakeview on Zwanze Day 2013, split with dwm1034 on Christmas Eve 2013. Pours a hazy light amber color with a thin white head that quickly fades. Aroma is funky, yeasty, some lemony citrus. Medium on the palate with light carbonation. Flavor is sour, citrus, lemon, some barnyard funk, maybe just a touch of cognac, maybe, with a dry, sour finish. The cognac barrel seems a little lost, but otherwise an excellent lambic.

Big thanks to my good friend sebletitje for getting me a bottle of this and making me a tasting event hero. Thanks again buddy. The 75cl bottle pours with a clear deep gold body that supports a long lasting white head of foam. The aroma is typical Cantillon with tartness, acidic notes, yeasty soured citrus and a mild level of earthy basement. The taste has acidic notes, tart non acidic citrus and then more of an earthy lemon lime like quality. It gets a bit woody and yeasty around the edges and ends with a moderate pucker and dryness. Beneath those pesky notes is a yeasty funked up basement dustiness.

Bottle sampled @ Daks Black Friday tasting. Clear new penny pour. Dusty, leafy, musty, damp. Barnyard and wet hay. Lemony and moderately pungent. Tart unripened citrus and a hint of wood and cognac from the barrel. Cantillon can be a huge hit or miss for me...this was a hit. Big thanks to whomever brought it!

Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Pours clear golden with a small off white head. Aroma is funky stable cellar barrel astringent. Flavor is bitter funky astringent, some solvent vinegar acid cognac medium sour. Well balanced and very tasty.

Pours hazy golden with no head
Aromas of bretta, sour yeast, sweet fruits, 
Taste is well balanced with a great mix between the sour fruits and the sweetness from the barrels

Pours hazy golden amber with low white head. Aroma of apples, peach, mango, bretta, kiwi, gooseberry. Taste is heavy tart with clear barrel infusion and slightly astringent finish. Body is light and champagne crisp with fairly moderate carbonation.

Bottle shared by tom10101, thanks! It was a long time want for me and it really lived up to my expectations! Pours a clear gold with a light rim that leaves low lace. Taste is of white grapes, spirits over a lightly funky background. Body is light, texture oily/soft. Boozy finish but again in a good way. Great, I would drink this all the time!

Un élégant lambic avec ses notes de pomme verte, poire, raisin et cuir mais enrobé dun beurre de noisette presque vanille provenant du baril de cognac. La lumière sest allumée tout de suite à la première gorgée, les sucres naturels, le lambic bien aiguisé et le vieillissement se marient tellement bien, fantastique surprise.

Pours golden mostly clear with a light orange hue and frothy sandy head. Aroma brings some tangy yeast and undertones of the cognac with a hint of booze. Flavor brings the cognac undertones ad well at the end of he sip, some juicy citrus and orange notes are there as well.

Bottle at the brewery- 6 Nov 2013. Nose is apples, woodiness with a bit of funk. Taste is less sour than I'd expected with the cognac well hidden until the end. Mouthfeel is more full than normal.

Overall, was disappointed because its cantillon but still a nice lambic...

750ml Corked and Caged bottle brought back from Cantillon for my friends wedding reception. Hell yeah! Pours a hazy copper with a lazy white head of foam that sticks around. The aroma is just a light funk with more pronounced oak and vanilla. I dont get Cognac per se, but I can tell theres a difference in barrels used. The taste, again, was more just a slightly funky beer with some fruity qualities, which are nice. My only knock on this beer is that it just wasnt sour enough. That didnt keep it from being delicious, though.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2013 pours hazy yellow with a nice white cap, good retention and lacing. white grapes, oak, barn, lemongrass, peppery, fruity - hint of pineapple, nice funkiness. bright to average carbonation, light body, semi-dry bretty herbal-grassy and astringent finish. cognac barrels clearly enhance fruity flavors but imparts a bit of sweetness and not that much complexity or depth. very enjoyable!  had a second bottle two weeks after the first one and cognac was much more present, brandied fruits, quite cheesy too.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 20.04.2013, 0,75l bottle shared with ClubGonzo & ej @ the brewery:
Lett fyldig og tørr lukt med preg av lys malt, sitrus, tørka frukt, tre, syregras. Frisk lett tørr og syrlig smak med preg av lys malt, sitrus, tre, syregras, sitrusskal. Middels bitterhet som set litt. Grei.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours nice clear blond with low white head. Some lacing. Aroma is of funk, barnyard, citrus, fruits. Taste is of funk, some acidity, cheese, citrus. Spicy feeling on the tongue. Barnyard. Palate: Light body, low but decent carb. Overall: Very good. Clean. Nice barnyard. Very fruity. Somewhat refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2014 October 27th 2013: Bottle (750 ml). 2013 Vintage. Thanks to GrumpyOldTroll for this one! Clear bright golden with a small white head and good lacing. Theres a lot of wood/oak in the aroma along with light funky notes, hints of cognac, fruity notes and light sweetness. Taste is slightly sweet with a lot of oak again (less than aroma though), apples, light cognac and light sourness. Light to medium body. Low carbonation. Slightly dry and somewhat winey. Mild. Not as sour as most gueuzes. Complex, but much less than Crianza Helena. Delicate. Unique and quite good. 8-4-8-4-16

EDITED: I tried it 2 weeks after the first time. Same batch and from the same trade. The cognac was somewhat more present in that one, especially in the taste which gives the beer more complexity. I added .1 to the overall. 4-8-8-4-17

UPDATE: I tried it again at Cantillon on April 18th 2014. We decanted it for 1 hour in a jar before drinking it and it makes all the difference. Wow! Now we can feel the cognac in this one, in both the nose and the aroma. Way more complex this way and you even get a little more warming presence in the mouthfeel. Lesson learned: you have to give these cognac aged Cantillon the time to breathe. Awesome Gueuze! 9-4-9-4-19 = 4.5

Bottle. Clear pale gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is funky, quite a bit of oak, much more oak aroma than Im used to for lambic, light cheesy notes, rather tame for a cantillon. Taste is fruity, light oaky notes, a bit winey, not very sour at all, med-dry. Palate is light, low carbonation. Delicate beer, very subtle.

2013 vintage Thanks to Owen for the bottle

Hazy yellow color, some subtle lacing and some subtle half inch head. Thicker ABV legs with this though. 
Nose is apple, pear, citrus, and after a bit oak and cognac. More muddled and heavy than the lower ABV Cantillon offerings. 
Taste is a lot of oak, cognac, wine, apple, pear and citrus. More like a wooded fume blanc with the amount of oak and fruit. Very vinous character. 
Feel is much more about the barrel. Oaked fruit, slightly heavy and a lot less carbonation than others. Nice but possible too heavy and not as lifted. Fun to try but was a bit meh about it

Back room dealings at What the Funk!? Bottle - 2013 Vintage. Pour is hazy yellow with no head - decent lacing. Super funky, lemony, oaky, citrusy, a touch of grass, urine, somewhat spicy, and floral aroma. Taste is citrus, lemon peel, funk, barrel characteristics - wood, caramel, toffee - fresh cut grass, dough, and urine with a lightly tart finish. Medium body with soft carbonation. Not very sour, but definitely has some funk going on - well balanced. Very unique and such a treat to try.

Bottle from the Brewery. Light golden colour, small bubbly white head. Aroma is funky, good sourness, boozy from the cognac I guess. Bit of citrus punch too. Lemon sherbert. Taste is good. Flat creaminess, nice sourness but not overly so, aftertaste is quite dry and creamy. Pretty different. Definitely more mellow than the regular one. Punch is quite fruity, grapefruit and berries too. Gooseberry. Great stuff.

750ml capped and corked bottle served from a lambic basket into my WLV Zwanze day taster. Batch 2, 2013 release.

A: Pours a clear, golden yellow color with a bubbly white head forming on the pour. It recedes to a thin ring.

S: Lemony with a sweet cognac backing. Oak with a slight sourness to it. A little acetone as well. Slightly acidic as well.

T: Really oaky with a lemon grass bite. Slightly acidic citrus with the cognac sweetness. Vanilla oak sweetness with a sweet malt profile. Little sour bite as well.

M: Light bodied with a bubbly carbonation level. Oaky finish.

O: A little rough around the edges at this point. I think it needs some time to let the Cognac meld into the beer and some of the funk to come up. Still a really nice beer.

Serving type: bottle

08-03-2013

Bottle at nüetnigenough, Brussels late August. Hotel internet died as I finished writing the rating- memory rating... Pours goldy orange, little head. Smells.. Fruity, sour and the cognac barrels super present, smooth. Tastes.. Milder or rather smoother than the cant gueuze, still sour and fruity and funky, but rounded off with sweetness and alcohol from the cognac barrels. This remains in my top 3 out of 100 odd beers tasted on the August euro beer safari

The cognac barrels really work well with the gueuze to create an aroma focused incarnation. The flavor is also complex and integrated although the character is still somewhat racy. Sourness is intense but does not overshadow.

750 ml bottle sample thanks to NobleSquirrel at RBSG 2010. Pours a golden orange color with a medium sized white head. The aroma has a nice blend of sweet and sour; white grapes, additional fruity notes apple, cognac, barrel notes, funk, horseblanket, straw with some sour/acidic character. The flavor has definite cognac notes from the barrel which brings some alcohol in, vinous notes, funk, tart notes some acidity, some sweetness, oak and vanilla. I am glad to have had the chance to try this one.

Bottle on Zwanze Day at soho pub with beerdrifter. Hazy straw with no head. Nose is sour and funky with lemon and orange zest. Mouth is tart and light, smooth sourness and a touch of elderflower, cognac sweetness lasts. Utterly superb.

Mild lambic aroma initially, barrels and hay join the fray. More funky in the aroma than on the palate. Kinda mild and boring taste honestly. Barrels are most prominent, yet it's mostly muted. Disappointed.

Bottle courtesy cparles, shared at Collected Works tasting. Incredible aroma, just everything you want gueuze to be. Very fruity with prominent vinous and lemon notes, with a significant horsey funk. Not quite as cobwebby/basementy as some gueuzes but I like this better. Flavor is similar, unripe wine grapes, lemon, lime pulp, straw and wet wood, cognac influence really brightens the beer. Just lovely.

Bottle: Served in a Snifter:
Small airy ashy off white head/lacing on top of an almost clear, light cloudy to pale yellow golden colored beer.
Aroma has lots of green apples, there some funky tones, wild yeast, something lemon ish, some wet wood, light sour and the slightest hint of cognac.
Flavour is white vinous, light cognac, dust, light sour, malts, some berries, some apples and grapes, some wild yeast and a typical Cantillon touch.
Aftertaste is sour, wild yeast, cheese, wood, barnyard and some dried hay and hops.
Medium carbo, good medium to lightly fuller body a bit dry and a watery to light creamy texture.
Expected a bit more but far from bad.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle sample at a sour beer tasting at Beer & Beyond. Thanks beerandbeyond. Pours yellow with a small head, aroma of lavender, brett, lemon, melon and manure, flavor is bretty with lavender, lemon skin, fruitiness, wine, wood, medium to full bodied,nice carbonation, great brew

75cl bottle at home in São Paulo. Batch 1 vintage 2004. This beer was tried side by side with a 2002 Lou Pepe Kriek and this was much better! It was very Gueuze like after all these years but the cognac barrel was still in evidence especially in the aroma. The flavour had a depth to it that the standard Gueze lacks but its richer. Sometimes I prefer the lightness of the standard Gueuze but this does have a depth that makes it special.

Bottle at the ba buffalo bottle share. Oh you fucking brittle cork. Finally pushed in with a quick spray. Causes chaos, a mess, beer spilling. Finally in the glass as light golden. My shirt is wet. Light funk, tart. Not as acidic as others. Excellent.

50 Batch 2 from 2013. Decent sample at a bottle share. Nice clear pour, looks bronze with no head at all. Nose is interesting. A lot sweeter and more mild than regular gueuze. Almost armagnac on the nose. I get some candy as well with papaya. Taste is interesting. Loads of tartness, the 2 years of time in barrels gives this a hearty oakiness with sugary Liqueur sweetness of oranges, caramel and lemons. Hearty body, and very drinkable. Its quite nice but I prefer classic gueuze.
Super rare beer thanks to friends of GT2 at the los Angeles beer tasting, awesome hazy sour here

Bottle sample at a sour beer tasting at Beer & Beyond. Thanks beerandbeyond. Pours headless, cloudy and yellow. Wooden aroma, some brandy and wet straw. Pungent, sour and bitter too. No carbonation, rotten citrus aftertaste. medium body.

Original batch, courtesy of Ryan. Another Cantillon Im not the hugest fan of, somewhat heavy on the palate with a cognac flavor and a bit of weird sweetness, lacks the creative fruity quality I really like in a good Cantillon. I think Cantillon does amazing fruit lambics but their Gueuzes generally (GENERALLY) fall behind DF.
Gedronken @ RBESG 13 Grand Tasting, geel en heldere kleur, witte schuimkraag, ruikt en smaakt naar groene appels, beetje muf en zuur, er zijn betere van cantillon

Pours a glowing orange color. Aromas of oak, candied citrus peel, mild funk, and straw. The palate is a bit heavier than most Cantillons, with flavors of oak, Cognac spirit, tart lemon, and light spice/heat, maybe some light balsamic vinegar. Finishes dry and acidic.

Batch #1 Bottle care of Barry. Pours clearish orange with light lace and head that wasnt lasting. Heavy notes of barn funk, rich wood, florals, dry fruit, and very restrained cognac which was great. Cognac can get too aromatic or perfumey but this one was super light letting the vtg gueuze profile shine. Other notes of lemon rind, apple, leather, and horseblanket. Body was very silky and soft with lighter carbonation. We had this next to an 09 blabaer, but I think I might like this slightly better....even got a second pour of a couple ounces....Score!

75cl bottle from La Cave à Bulles in Paris. Im not only celebrating my graduation from Siebels Master Brewer Program with this beer, but my retirement from rating. Pours a clear golden colored body with a finger-width, creamy and frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is sour and acidic with some lemons as well as a nice funk. A light cognac note with some wet wood, apricots, and just a touch of sweetness. Flavor is awesome. Acidic and sour lemons with a good amount of funk, wet wood, a light cognac, a hint of malt sweetness, apricots and peaches, white grapes, and a slight herbal note. Finishes dry and woody with a balanced acidity, a nice fruitiness, and a light cognac warmth. Lengthy aftertaste following a smooth, light body and a soft, medium-light carbonation. Overall, an excellent beer. More of a lasting head than most lambics and very well balanced. The wood and cognac play perfectly with the acidity and the bigger ABV% keeps everything in check while maintaining a very easy drinking body. A great beer to go out on.
Pours a cloudy yellow/golden color with with a weird, old funk that I cant describe. Flavors of a mild tartness and a slight fruity finish.

Bottle shared at Brasserie Cantillon. Pours golden yellow with a short, white lively head and thin lacing. Big cognac aroma, lots of lemon peel, grass, white wine and green apple peel. Taste is smooth sourness, barrels really rounded off the flavours to a sweet, champagne and cognac-esque taste with an extremely well balanced sweet and sour tartness. Lingering flavours of lemongrass, white wine and green apples. Superb beer, best sour I've had.

Original Batch, reviewed on 10-10-10, 750ml bottle.

Pours a golden yellow, fizzy head with dissipates into a thin film on top and a thin ring around the glass. Smells like ass...literally. Baby diapers, huge funk, slight sourness. I dont know if I should admit this or not, but I kept reaching for the bottle and smelling it...whew! Nasty goodness! Big on the funk, light on the tartness, lemon zest, cognac oak notes, nice tart alcohol finish mixed with some good in there. Light, fizzy carbonation, very dry finish.

Wow. Had two pours of this funky stuff. The taste lingered with me long after I was finished. Very unique and cool offering by the one and only Cantillon.
Bottle. Clear pale golden beer with a small white head. Sourish and fruity aroma. A bit sourish and fruity flavour with some woody notes. Nice one :-)

Sampled @ RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Hazy pale yellow colour with a lacing white head. Smells sour, green apple and some rubber. Tastes green apple, sour, fresh and some lemon. Thin to medium body and fizzy carbo.

0.75 L bottle, shared with good friends @Brasserie Cantillon. Pours a hazy yellow body with a low white top. Citrus, funk, wood and distinct cognac on the nose. Taste is cognac forward. Oak tones, citrus-fruitiness and gently sour-acidic. Very easy on the palate. Dry funky endnotes. [22.04.13]

(bottle) pours a murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of peaches, herbal hops, pepper and earth, heavy lemons and some bread dough. flavour is quite grassy, again with lots of lemons and bread dough, light banana skins and a slightly tart light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle at RBESG 13 Grand Tasting. Pours hazy yellow with almost no head. Nice geuze aroma, barn, sweet, not very sour. Taste has some barn, citurs, nicely fresh and fruity. Medium body and carbo.

Bottle at the RBESG 2013 Grand Tasting. Poured a hazy light amber with a thin glass hugging white head. The aroma is big yeast, leading to a medium sour, citrus grapefruit flavour. Its surprisingly smooth and has a lovely lingering finish.

Sample at rbesg 2013.
Thin white head. Slightly hazy blond pour. Some subtle sour notes

Bottle @ RBESG grand tasting. Hazy yellow color, small white head. Smell and taste sourness, sour fruits, sour green apple, orangepeel and apricot. Maybe slightly less balanced than other Cantillons, but still very nice. Prefer others though.

RBESG 2012. Bottle during Grand Tasting at De Molen. Quite clear yellow beer with a small white head. Fruity sourish aroma, tart, leather, citrus, acidic notes, peach, grapefruit, woodsy notes, hay, floral, some dandelions. Fruity sourish flavor, hay, leather, woody, sour, acidic, hay, dandelions, woody, cognac notes. Fruity sour finish, still with a great drinkability. Great beer!
Citroengeel bier. Matig schuim. Ruikt champagne zuur. Smaakt als champagne. Iets te zuur.
Pours a golden pale with a good white head. Smells medium sour. Tastes very good. Nice sour.

Bottle, courtesy of 77ships, @ Rampkrot tasting. Pours a hazy blonde beer with a small amount of white head on top. Thnx to kraddel for pouring it into the original Cantillon balloon glass. Aroma of Brett, sour fruit and a big oaky presence. The two years on cognac defintely gives its aroma to the beer. Flavour starts of sour with loads of fruits. The finish is quite bitter, oaky and dry. Very well drinkable, very good as well.

Bottle from 77ships@ Rampkrot whale tasting. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Pretty standard Lambic sour aroma. Taste is a nice balanced sourness (not too strong, not too light). Very easy drinking

Bottle shared at Rampkrot Whale Tasting thanks to 77ships. Pours hazy gold yellow with a ring white head. Aroma of barnyard, horse blanket, cognac, apple, citrus, tart fruit. Flavour is light sweet, light moderate sour. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at the brewery. Hazy golden liquid with small to medium white head. Aroma of lemons, dried fruit, apples, barnyard, bread and light fruity funk. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of dried fruit, lemons and apples. Very smooth and balanced. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice.

Bouteille 75cl #3941 @ Cantillon shared with the Göteborg team.
Dorée paille présentant un léger trouble, col blanc fin.
Arôme restitue encore ici toute la signature de Cantillon. Note poussiéreuse et ce côté unique de lassemblage des lambics. Le tout relevé par le mûrissage en fûts de Cognac. Ce dernier laissant des effluves moyennes de pomme agrémenté dun léger côté citrique.
Palais garde ici aussi, ce profil poussiéreux, pointe de pomme, barrique et cognac avec une touche orangée-citronnée presque de pelure qui couplé aux côté pomme-Cognac confère une certaine douceur en fin de bouche. Le grains reste subtile. A redécouvrir plus tard car je nai pas trop accroché au Cognac.
Härligt underbar cantillon. Lite läskande samtidigt som fatet måste ha bidragit med någon typ av komplexitet.

Bottle many many thx to Seb cons 2013-06-08 Mölndal
AR: sour dough, tart, yeast, green apples, 
AP: hazy coppery, wee thin white head
F: tart, marzipan, yeasty, gooseberries, apple calvodas, dry,

Bottle at Endos house, 25/05/13, thanks to DW for this beauty.
Lightly hazed pale golden/orange with a very thin white head.
Nose is lemon rind, funkoclock, wood notes, musty tones, Grandads shed, hint of booze from the BA although I couldnt pick out cognac specifically.
Taste comprises damp wood, must, funk, leomon, grass, tarte apple skin, barnyard.
Medium bodied with fine carbonation, a very gentle dose of warming booze in the finish which is crisp and clean.
Excellent Gueuze.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: MAY 27, 2013 Bottle. Thanks Andrew! This is a bottle from the latest release. Pours a slightly cloudy amber wheat color with a collared white head. Funky, funky aroma! Lemon, wet basement, and barrel. The smell is just fantastic, I could smell this all night. Medium/light mouthfeel. Apricot, lemon, funk, and some green apple. Splendid. The barrel aging adds flavors that I have not had in other beers. Really glad to be able to finally try this beer.

Bottle @ Cantillon, Brussels, shared with Inbreak and ej. Pours a cloudy light straw yellow body with a small white head. Aroma is cognac, straw, wood, floral dry herbal tones and hints of citric peel and horseblanket. The cognac feels somewhat alien in this mix, but it sure is funky regardless! :-) Taste is mellow wood-dry cognac tones, hints of straw and horseblanket. Surprisingly dry and barrel-ish, with significant cognac in the back - to a much larger degree than what appears in the aroma. A bit too much wood on the palate, which makes the body appear withered and thin. A bit peculiar, and not the best of geuzes IMO but a fun idea by Cantillon.
Hazy golden pour. Funky aroma, cognac, oak, grapes, berries, lemon, leather. Flavor is not sour, nice funk, barnyard, lots of cognac flavors, wood tannins. Cantillon with another.

Bottle @ home 2013 release. 

Amazing how the cognac blends so elegantly into a beer one of my favourite Cantillons.

Bottle at Cantillon, pours a fairly clear light golden with a small white head. The nose imparts fresh cognac notes upfront, along with wood and oak, followed by a medium acidity, tart dry light fruits. Flavour isnt as acidic or funky as many lambics, with mellow notes of cognac, followed by wood, oak, some tannins and medium tartness. Medium acidity, with only subtle flavours imparted from the cognac barrels -- though you can tell theyve affected this beer in many ways. Fairly soft carbonation. Certainly a nice lambic, but not on the level that is suggested by its hype and rarity.

75cl, exclusive brew, from De Hopduvel Gent (yet only available as a trade!), complex sour brew, sour/woody and slightly alcoholic/fruity, yet very balanced, hazy, nearly no head, very good brew, yet expensive!

Bottiglia 75 cl direttamente in birreria.
Chiara torbida.
Schiuma inesistente o quasi.
Poco frizzante, acida e amara, sentori di cognac...
Difficile da bere.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iFox

drank side by side with pikku, 4/25/2013, thanks dan

A-  golden amber with a thin layer of white head

N-  Barnyard funk, grass, sour grape, booze

T-  Strong barrel flavor, wood, grapes, earth,lemon peel, sweetness from cognac, warming yet smooth on the back.  malt comes across my palate when i swished it around.

M-  smooth on the palate with a dry finish

bottle at brewery. new batch pre-release date. golden pour, light white bubbles, sweet tartness, floral honey, lighter than expected cognac integration. Medium acidity, light sweettart candy flavor towards finish. amazing

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 75cl bottle at Cantillon, new batch. Aged on Cognac barrels that were used for 25 years. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: lightly clouded blonde beer, small stable head.
Nose: very intense sourness, grains, very fruity, lemon, apple, grass, hay, barnyard. Very complex, already in the nose.
Taste: drinks away very dry from the beginning. A rather fruity but also alcoholic finish. Has many hints of wood. The sourness on the other hand is less prominent. You dont notice the cognac in it whatsoever, its just a very dry geuze, very nice to drink. But, it completely dries out your mouth when drinking a bigger swig. Altogether, very enjoyable beer!

new batch at Cantillon 
Head: small, white 
Colour: pale/faint hazy yellow ( bit like a fine champagne 
Smell: dry, fine sparkling, sour, bitter, some wheats 
Taste: start is bitter and dry , the comes a fine malty flavour with a refined sour touch, not exactly cognac but i can find something of the flavour in it, unique and deffinitly gorgeous !

750 ml bottle sampled in 2008. Slightly hazy orange body with a rather small white head. Aroma is a bit modest acidic, fruity, funky with cognac. Flavor is both sweet and acidic, fruity, some kind of bitter with a hint of cognac. Less cognac flavor than expected. Fine body, low carbonation, smooth aftertaste. Refreshing, complex and a bit different lambic.

Sampled from Bottle courtesy of some awesome stranger at Spuyten during Zwanze Day 2012. Pours a deep thick amber golden body with light lacing. Aroma is lemon funk, barnyard, light oak and sour fruit. Mouthfeel is medium with nice acidity and notes of sour fruit, cognac barrel, oak, citrus, barnyard funk, and lemon. Awesome, and very lucky to randomly try this Cantillon offering.

Wow what a treat! Thanks Chris and Steven for sharing this motha with me. Nose is big gueuze aroma with tons of lemon, earthiness, musty barnyard funk, and a slight touch of cognac. Very pronounced aromas. Pour is typical, a light hazy yellow color. Flavor is earthy, again, with tons of strong barynard and lemon zest. The cognac dropped of a bit here but I get an oakiness not delivered in the aroma. Very cool and different gueuze.
Pours a light gold spicy and sour with backnotes of congac. Sour but not overwhelmingly so

Sample from the dregs of a bottle at WtWBA.  Dreggy golden appearance.  Smell is all barnyard, as in, people talk about barnyard, but this smells like working on the horse farm growing up.  Taste is lemony and a bit funky.  Really amazing, my favorite Gueuze by far.  Average body and perfect carb.

Bottle, 10/28/2012. Google Maps reveals this should rightly be called 50.84151°N-4.33566°E.  Brilliant golden amber pour, little head but slick glaze of foam on the surface, ring of tight bubbled lacing. Aroma is white grape, green apple, pear, lemon rind tartness, straw malts, lots of earthy barnyard funk with vanilla, wood, subtle cognac. Taste is tart green apple, orange and mild grapefruit, more earthy funk, bit of cognac sweetness with actually a hint of boozy heat, finishes dry. Medium body, slick and vinous. Wow, very complex, nice.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2013 # 25 Cantillon  took a while to get to 25  which was sort of the number of Cantillons I wanted to try at least back when I got into Cantillon  didnt expect to come across this one before the second batch came out  still looking forward just as eagerly for the upcoming batch  one can never have too much Cantillon  brewed 05/05/2006  bottled 30/05/2007  firstly this is almost unnervingly different from LH12  whilst the LH12 is way more out of the ballpark of Cantillon and this one leans close to the standard geuze taste-wise  this one is almost unquestionably head and shoulders above the pure lambic version  LH12 is also very; very different from a standard Cantillon lambic  or at least a 3 yr old  havent really had anything else as ancient as the LH12  pure lambic-wise  75 cl. bottle unfairly / fairly split between me and Kraddel with me getting the lions share  pours an opaque orange / bright golden with a fluffy, almost creamy in a lambic-fashion head that sort of tries to hold itself  smell is such rich an full Cantillon funk, much fuller and more solid that one would expect, light herbal & Cognac notes popping up here as well but way more mellow and complimenting rather than full-on, touch melon, some plastic nature  in a good way that is to say  Cantillon citrus and straw, absolutely marvellous  taste takes you down the same road, full, round Cantillon funk, rich; plenty of citrus, cobweb, that herbal nature remains interesting and complimentary, some more Cognac-like notes to be found in this one, melon, the Cantillon lemon is serious business on this, acidic, going towards puckering, consider myself a bit used to sour beers but this one you feel, lemon peel, light touch of wood; almost feels hot in the finish  smooth, full, low carb.  very easy to drink  usually I opt for geuzes + faro by 3F & fruit lambics by Cantillon but this one is serious contender amongst the better stuff I have had by 3F geuze-wise  as usual with this kind of stuff; it is a bit hard to tell what plays a bigger role here with the increased quantity, the aging or the special nature of this one  most likely a combination, I do think that this one would def. top a Cantillon of this age  looking forward to how a fresh one from the second batch will be like /// tried a bottle of the 2013 batch at the brewery, insanely strong cognac, almost alcohol, hard to drink, very different, interesting /// tried a different bottle from the 2013 batch, cognac is very subtle in this one, subtle oak, interesting, high quality & subtle geuze but clearly needs age still to develop the necessary complexity, both were too young /// 4.9 score is for the 2007 batch /// 2013 is still far too young, no where near 4.9 currently but will possibly become with age

bottled shared with 77 ships @ delirium
very subtile, nice balanced , soft sourness, tastes of the cognac , small aftertaste, dry. good beer

Bottle at Delirium, Brussels. It pours clear golden yellow, with a thin white head. The nose is sweet apple, pear, stewed fruit, blackcurrant, jaminess, sour apple chewits, sweet white grape, melon and vinous aspect. The taste is floral, obvious alcohol, medium acidity, light vinegar, sour apple, pear, pear drops, wood, tanginess, vinous, white grape, tangerine, astringency and some odd brunt plastic/chemically note in the background, with a boozy, acidic finish. Medium body and fine/low carbonation. Complex, but for me the balance is not there. A bit too alcoholic and acidic for me. Good, but not great.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 I was lucky enough to get to try this when it was still called Cognac Lambic at Akkurat. on the cork it said 2007 as well as the handwritten label. it was a subtle tone of cognac but also the usual tone of Cantillon lambic Fantastic. but the best thing I did was to eat cheese with beer, what a food pairing! A lightly carbonated that caresses the palate at the same time as the cognac flavors remain in the finish indefinitely.

I have also tasted the "regular" 50N4E which is also a fantastic beer but it has a prickly taste that I do not agree with, this is probably the cognac. still a great beer though! but it feels young, too young for its own good. (havent had the 2007 50N4E!

750 ml bottle generously shared by ipa247.  Thanks Jeff.  Pours a clear golden amber with no head.  There are a couple of bubbles around the edge of the glass and no lacing.  The aroma is funky with the cognac presence obvious and a bit of oak.  There is also a light mushroom note.  A bit of alcohol is there as well.  Its not a lot, but more than any other lambic Ive had.  The initial taste has a light sweetness with a decent tartness.  There is some funky oak, a bit of brandy, and some mushroom.  The finish has some brandy and a bit of alcohol.  Medium body.  Low carbonation.  Not bad, but certainly not my favorite Cantillon beer.  It could have used a little more carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2013 19/04/13. Bottle of the newest batch @ Cantillon. Big apple skin aromas. Plent of wood. Soft acccents of white wine and concord grape. Plenty of caramel. Only mildly sour. Pretty decent. 3.9. 

Bottle @ Delirium, Brussels. The pours slightly hazy gold with a medium fluffy white head. The nose is bright sugary biscuit, cobweb, dust. Accents of hot herbs and light lemon acidity. A bit spicy, some dried wood. The taste is tart, dried lemon cake. Dank basement funkiness. Post-Katrina drywall.  Hot, herbal, woody, but tasty. Light body, but agressive on the palate. Overall, pretty good.

Bottle shared by nerd. Thanks Michael!

The beer is slightly translucent and golden hued, with about a quarter inch of white, foamy head. Ah...the aroma. Cantillon has done it again, and I already know I am in for a treat. The nose brings big gueuze scents, classic Cantillon funk, straw, hay, light citrus. The flavor is phenomenal. I love what the cognac barrel has done here. The feel on the palate is just a bit fuller than the normal gueuze, with added complexity and depth from the cognac barrels. 

This is the second amazing cognac barrel-aged brew I have had this year. Im not necessarily a big fan of cognac, per se, but apparently, when done right, it can really invigorate a beer and add a wealth of complexity and flavor.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-05-2011

Bottle @ Akkurat. Fairly clear, golden orange appearance with an off white head. Tangy, dark berry, cognac, vinous, grape, vanilla, woody nose. Lightly boozy, woody, tart/tangy lemon, orange citrusy, rich grape cognac flavor. A lot going on and fairly delicious.

Bottle thx to R&F. One of the most attractive lambics ive seen in a while, looking like it should with slight haze, light amber. Pungent, deep, house character, sucking on Florida orange peel, astringent, gorgeous. Luscious. Dry, acetic, endlessly satisfying.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours pale yellow with a large white head.  Nose is boozy, wood, vinegar, sour apples, leather, barnyard funkery.  Taste is sweet, with an enourmouse wave of tart that peaks several times throughout the taste ultimately dominating the aftertaste.  Amazing complexity.  Mouthfeel is soft, creamy yet fizzy.  The body is medium to heavy and has a very long finish.  Amazing.

Opened by Dan at our Thursday whale tasting. Been waiting a long time for this one. Pours a hazy brownish orange in color with some soapy bubbles. Nose is incredibly unique for a Cantillon. Unlike Crianza, the cognac character is actually pretty prominent. There is gueuze underneath the blanket of cognac and oak. Flavor is pretty heavy cognac and then it falls back onto the gueuze. The acidity is pretty sharp. Mouthfeel is light and carbonation is low, some light heat from the cognac. Extremely unique gueuze by Cantillon. I know Jean hated how this turned out, but I liked it a lot. Cant wait to open my bottle.

750ml at Akkurat in Stockholm, May 2012 (3.9)

brew date 18.01.2005, bottle date 30.03.2007
light hazed gold body with a small white head. mild but pleasant floral soap and fruit ester nose (peaches, mandarin orange, white grape) with mild acids. white grape juice flavor more so than cognac and oak, both light. light cork noticed throughout. sweetened tropical / pear juice with touches of apple and strawberry, all perfumed. oily and waxy texture, medium-thin body. seems a bit faded but its still pleasantly acidic and nuanced, though at this point its not the most complex cantillon ive had and not as good as my memory from 2008. second pour is much more expressive and more doughy, more minerallic and musty and complex, with soft touches of tart and dry raspberry and strawberry once again, but the cognac barrel is still largely muted.

First rating, April 2008 (4.0)
Clear yellow pour with just a little bit of haze.  Wine grape, hay and pear nose, prickly, tart, spritzy, lively and festive.  Flavor is moderately tart, fruity, a bit pale, smooth and subdued - mellow - with some bright notes of pear, grape and wheat.  Very smooth, thin and silky on the tongue, with a developing sour lactic note in the finish that is remarkably smooth.

Shared by Jens ungstrup at his place at his "after ølbutikken tasting catch-up tasting". Finally found my note for this one today.
Cloudy orange, small white head. aroms is barnyard, hops,  stables., flavor is wildt yeasty, quite tart, flavors are perfectly balanced, taste is very very good, I hope to try it again someday.
20th July 2009Hazy gold beer. Sour and lemony but not out of control. The subtlest touch of cognac and oak peeping through. Just another overrated sour beer but at least drinkable.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2012 Shared bottle to snifter.  Looks good; like a good geuze. Smells great; sour. Tastes like angels in my mouth! This is AMAZING! Mouthfeel is awesome too. My current vote for best beer Ive ever had.

Bottle from Ølbutikken. Barnyard, citrus, grape, apple, all with a bit of oak but utterly lacking in "cognac" :) Smooth (almost too much so?), hazy. Overall, not an essential Cantillon, but it was fun.
#1382 bottle; Nose is grape, little diacetyl, later apple acid, feel is watery, carb is very low, taste Is bile, sour red grape, weak spice, cloves hint, late weak, sweet Apple acid

Appearance:  Pours a hazy yellow gold with a thin white film.

Aroma: Barnyard funk, lemon and  perfume.

Taste: Astringent tannins and sour funk. Not much malt presence. Finishes pretty bitter.

Mouthfeel: Puckering.

Overall:  The cognac barrel treatment along with the particular yeast strain made this very earthy and bitter, Id have to try more of this to see if I like it or not.

Bottle shared by Bill at the Philly tasting.  Cloudy yellow pour with a white head.  Stank ass feet aromas.  Sour with citrus notes and some vanilla and oak from the barrels.  Medium acidity, medium body, with wonderful balance.  Had this side by side with Crianza and LH12.  It might be my favorite of the three.
Bottle. Pours an unclear golden with a white head. Smells of horse blanket, barnyard, sour Brett. Tastes sweet, smooth, and sour. Very well blended.

Flaska på Akkurat - Stockholm 2011
Lite diskret doft. Aning spritig och söt.
Inte mycket syrlighet och även frukten är borta. Ganska strev och torr vätska

Bottle at Akkurat, January 2012. Vintage 2007. 

Hazy golden with a small white head. Pleasant , rather soft sour aroma with oak, cognak and fruit. Tha taste was sour, but not extremely sour. Dry with grass, citrus some apples and oak. Also notes of "Cognac". This was an interesting and rather complex beer. Not as tasty as Cantillon Reed Gueuze Pinot Noir that we drank the same night but still very good.

750 ml bottle @ Akkurat on December 16. Bottled 2007 and stored in their basement. Pours hazy golden with a small creamy white head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace. Smell is sour with a clear cognac character to it. Theres also green apples, vanilla, gastric acid, farmyard, leather and hay. Taste is dry, sour, slightly sweet and slightly bitter with cognac, apples, grass, vanilla, wood, hay, pears, gooseberries and slight hints of cacao and oxidation. Carbonation is low. Finish is very dry, tart and slightly bitter with cognac and gooseberries. Being a big fan of cognac and lambic I find the two marry perfectly in this beer. Its intense, complex and amazing.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2012 Bottle at Akkurat. Stockholm, 30th September 2011. 

Sourish and quite sweet aroma of hay, barnyard, sweat, and oak. Beneath that fruity and sweet notes of syrup, pears, apples and vanilla. The brew is smooth and soft but quite light bodied. Some flavours of age and light oxidation. Apples, some sour tart but not the normal funkiness. Some alcohol coming through in the taste together with more vanilla and wood. Very interesting!

Bottle @ DRBM. A clear golden colored beer, with a small white head. The aroma of some sour with fruits and brandy. The taste is a little grassy and some sweet moving to sour, with notes of wood. The aftertaste is some sweet with sour.

75cl Bottle at DRBM. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is light sour, funky, cognac, light fruity. Flavour is light sweet, light sour, obvious cognac barrel ageing, sour finish with some grapes. Light bodied. Not bad for a Gueuze.
